episodes.title: 3HO Tantric Yogis dance & chant crazy Yogi Bhajan mantras in Darbar of Siri Guru Granth Sahib JI
New HBO Docu Series, "Breath of Fire",  Reviewed by a Sikh & Former Follower of Yogi Bhajan
episodes.description:
Abuse and Manipulation
Mahan Kirn Kaur's testimony in HBO's "Breath of Fire" reveals her courageous account of being raped by Yogi Bhajan as a teen, supported by former bodyguard Gursant Singh's 30-year insider perspective.

Kundalini yoga, especially the Breath of Fire technique and playing of the "gong", induces a highly suggestible state, making practitioners vulnerable to indoctrination and manipulation by figures like Yogi Bhajan and Harijiwan Khalsa Jr aka "The Toner Bandit". 

Yogi Bhajan's practice of having female secretaries sleep in his room under the guise of "protecting their aura" in Los Angeles and Espanola is now recognized as very disturbing and debauched behavior.

Financial Fraud
Harijiwan Khalsa Jr aka "The Toner Bandit", a master manipulator trained in NLP, was indicted for fraud involving sending out invoices with no product. Harijiwan is accused by the author and former followers of using hypnotic gong playing to manipulate followers.

Another disciple of Yogi Bhajan with a similar name, Hari Jiwan Singh Khalsa was charged in a "field of schemes" by the Federal Trade commission and engaged in double invoicing for toner supplies, pocketing extra money from his partners under the pretense of funding Yogi Bhajan's lavish lunches.

Spiritual Corruption
Yogi Bhajan twisted Sikh scriptures (Gurbani) to create a sacrilegious mantra combining Gurbani verses with a chant to Baba Sirichand, corrupting the original teachings.

In 2009, Gursant Singh realized Yogi Bhajan was a fraud and his close disciples like the two Harijiwans were criminals who had engaged in fraudulent activities and manipulation, even after  Harijiwan Jr aka "The Toner Bandit" served 18 months in federal prison.

Legal and Ethical Issues
In 1986, Kate Felt sued Yogi Bhajan for abuse and rape, but Harijiwan Jr aka "the toner bandit" denied hundreds of abuse accounts in the Olive Branch report, despite overwhelming evidence.

The HBO docuseries inaccurately portrayed Sikhism, featuring a cut-haired activist violating Sikh code and omitting traditional Sikh perspectives on weapons and firearms.

Psychological Tactics
Yogi Bhajan's manipulative techniques, learned from his time as a customs officer in India, incorporated NLP and Richard Bandler's teachings to extract money, power, and sex from followers.

Kundalini yoga creates a synthetic high, luring people into the cult and facilitating indoctrination, posing both physical and spiritual dangers to practitioners.

The author worked through the effects of Yogi Bhajan's manipulation for over 40 years, highlighting the long-term impact of cult involvement on followers.

Dr. Trilochan Singh explains below how Yogi Bhajan mistranslated Gurbani in order to fit Yogi Bhajan's tantric & kundalini yoga asanas & kryas: http://www.gurmukhyoga.com/forum/index.php?id=195 
Misinterpretation of the Sikh Ideal 
of Raj-Yoga: Political and Spiritual Sovereignty
Patanjali's Yoga has been called Raja Yoga (Kingly or Royal Yoga) by Vivekananda and other great savants. Later on, every school of Yoga started applying this term to their own school of Yoga. So in Yoga literature this term simply means Royal Yoga or the Chief and outstanding Yoga. Yogi Bhajan applies it to his own brand of Yoga. Sikhism is not a school of Yoga, and as we have seen, it is highly critical of many Yoga systems, and positively the antithesis of Tantric Yoga. But Yogi Bhajan's theorists who are expert in distorting scriptures and translations employ the same trick on the interpretation of Raja Yoga also:

(1) Premka Kaur's distorted version
Raj jog takhat dian Guru Ram Das. The throne of Raja Yoga was given to Guru Ram Das forever.
p 1399, p 4621 M.M.S.

Manmohan Singh's Correct Translation
Guru Amardas has blessed Guru Ram Das with the secular and spiritual throne.

Author's Comments
Premka Kaur has again taken illegal steps to attribute to Manmohan Singh her own translation, with a motive that is quite clear. The complete text and translation of the verse states that "First it was Nanak Chand who brought to the world Light and Wisdom and then he gave his Sovereign powers and wealth to Angad who gave them to Amardas who gave this throne (gaddi) or Raj-Yoga [Miri Piri) to Guru Ram Das.

Author's Comment
God alone knows what will happen to Manmohan Singh's translation of the Adi Guru Granth if Premka Kaur and other 3HO Writers misuse and mishandle it as they have done here. These very Bard Poets have made it clear that this Raj-Yoga is Miri Piri in Persian and it is the well-known doctrine of Political and Spiritual Sovereignty. Guru Nanak and his successors were all called True King (Sacha Patshah) and for the whole of the 16th, 17th, and 18th centuries the Sikhs paid their loyalty only to this concept. 
The Sikh Free Press revealed new documents on April 14th 2015 which show conclusively that the Akal Takhat Jathedar declared in a 1977 hukamnama that neither "he nor anyone else gave the yogi any title or authority, and later threatened to excommunicate him for his sacrilegious teachings." In fact, Yogi Bhajan alone proclaimed himself "Siri Singh Sahib" and leader of the Sikhs in the West. (This takes some time to load so please be patient:) http://web.archive.org/web/20190327091059/http://www.sikhfreepress.org/headlines/2667/american-yogis-distort-sikh-scripture

episodes.title: Whistleblower Exposes 3HO Yogi Bhajan SSSC Board Candidates including pro YB leader Siri Mukta Singh
episodes.description:
Siri Mukta Singh Khalsa along with eight or so other over 60 year old, white male candidates running for the SSSC Board, all desire a return to the "good old days" when they were privileged to hang out with Yogi Bhajan, indulging in extravagant thousand dollar lunches and shopping for jewelry in Beverly Hills. 

While yoga students toiled for less than minimum wages at Golden Temple restaurants and other Yogi Bhajan enterprises, Yogi Bhajan sexually attacked his female students along with taking millions of dollars from naïve students' inheritances. 

All through the 80's, 90's and I believe into the 2000s, Siri Mukta Singh was using fake names on the phone and engaged in deceiving unaware secretaries to buy toner and other office products at highly inflated prices. You may have heard about Siri Mukta's close friend and business associate, Harijiwan, the "Toner Bandit" who spent 18 months in federal prison. 

Interestingly there was another Hari Jiwan who was the right hand man of Yogi Bhajan. Siri Mukta was also a close associate and friend of Hari Jiwan and they both spent a great deal of time going on expensive lunches and spending sprees with YB.      

Below you'll find accounts of the indulgences by Yogi Bhajan and his "good old boys". Don't forget that Hari Jiwan Singh Khalsa is a good friend and companion of Siri Mukta Singh. Siri Mukta Singh was at 80% of these thousand dollar lunches & shopping sprees in Beverly Hills. I, Gursant Singh, know because I was on guard duty for many of these outings. 

Yogi Bhajan and Hari Jiwan bought and sold gem stones and jewelry at Jerry's on Beverly Drive in Beverly Hills California, a favorite spot for their business activities. In June 1997,one year after this photo was taken, the Federal Trade Commission filed charges against Hari Jiwan. (Taken from an FTC press release) Hari Jiwan Singh Khalsa, also known as Stephen Jon Oxenhandler, a/k/a Bob Thomas; as part of "Project Field of Schemes." This law enforcement effort comprised of approximately 61 law-enforcement actions. In its complaint detailing the charges, the FTC alleged that the defendants routinely misrepresented the risk, value, appreciation and liquidity of the gemstones they sold and falsely claimed that consumers would realize tremendous profits. In addition, the defendants falsely pledged that they could and would easily liquidate consumers' gemstone portfolios after an 18-month holding period. In fact, according to the FTC, the defendants typically ceased all contact with consumers and refused to liquidate their gemstones after the 18-month period. Shortly after the complaint was filed, the court issued a temporary restraining order, froze the defendants' assets and appointed a temporary receiver over the corporate defendants.

I went to Jerry's shop in Beverly Hills with YB and HJ almost every day as I was on YB's security. I also took Shakti Parwha Kaur to Wells Fargo bank on Wilshire Blvd in Beverly Hills about three times a week to get gems and a new set of YB's jewelry that he would adorn himself with for that particular day depending on what the astrological stars said he should wear. Shakti would say, "Let's go get the crown jewels." When Shakti and I entered the room at the bank to open the numerous safe deposit boxes full of the precious stones, I was shocked the first time I saw the outrageous amount of trays displaying these huge gemstones.

"I went on a few of those shopping trips to Jerry's place in Beverly Hills. To me it seemed that Jerry and YB were running some sort of scam on those who were coerced into making purchases." http://forums.delphiforums.com/Kamallarose/messages?msg=1203.349

"YB and Jerry double-teamed people (not just the women), urging them to purchase things because they were 'beautiful' or 'good for your aura.' "

You may read all the many letters from Hari Jiwan with comments from former followers of Yogi Bhajan at: http://www.gurmukhyoga.com/forum/index.php?id=157

"On a gorgeous spring afternoon in 1989 the Siri Singh Sahib was viewing a special Cartier broach and chain when he received a call from one of his secretaries......."

The letter below trying to censor Gursant Singh's criticisms of Yogi Bhajan was e-mailed out in 2009 by the same Siri Mukta Singh who is presently running as a candidate for the SSSC board 

From: sirikhalsa@cybermesa.com
Sent: Thu 12/31/09 11:11 AM
To: sirikhalsa@cybermesa.com

Dear Sadh Sangat, It has come to my attention that a former member of our Sangat, Gursant Singh, has been emailing a copy of a book which is out of publication and approximately 30 years old to various Sangat members. We dealt with this negative publication many years ago. Evidently, this gentleman is continuing to try and discredit us and our beloved teacher. I send this with the prayer that you disregard any communication regarding this matter. And, I further pray that Guru Sant Singh focus on his life rather than ours.
Humbly, SS Siri Mukta Singh Khalsa

episodes.title: Yogi Bhajan's "Aquarian Sadhana" is disrespectful of Gurbani & the Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji
episodes.description:
The Beadbi (disrespect) of Gurbani and Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji you see in the video, takes place every morning inside the Yogi Bhajan dera Gurdwara. 
The woman in the video is a long time Yogi Bhajan disciple who is leading this Yogi Bhajan "Aquarian Sadhana". She is sitting where the camera is zooming in, just under the portrait of Guru Ram Das Ji in the Darbar of Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji. 
 In 1992 Yogi Bhajan commanded that all of his disciples - Sikhs and non-Sikhs do something he called the "Aquarian Sadhana". This was to be done "forever'. In other words it is a permanent part of Bhajanism. 

Yogi Bhajan instructed the "Aquarian Sadhana" should be done in the "Amrit Vella." He also commanded his disciples to perform this "sadhana" in the Gurdwara". 

Yogi Bhajan's "Aquarian Sadhana is a curious mixture of Gurbani, Yogi Bhajan kundalini yoga asanas and mantras that are cut and twisted from Gurbani. There is at least one Hindu Sanskrit mantra that is chanted during the Yogi Bhajan "Aquarian Sadhana".

The Wah Yantee mantra is a Hindu mantra chanted every morning at the Yogi Bhajan dera inside the Gurdwara!

The official 3HO Yogi Bhajan website describes this mantra as follows:
"This mantra was given by Patanjali, a great Yogi. It is said that over two thousand years ago Patanjali was lecturing students on prophets who would come in the iron age, the age of Kaliyug.
He prophesied Guru Nanak Dev Ji's coming into the world and gave the "Waa Yantee" mantra which describes Wahe Guru. 
The "Waa Yantee" mantra also predicted the coming of the "Wahe Guru" mantra.
The "Wah Yantee" mantra is known for awakening the intuition."

The Wha Yantee mantra  is one of the mantras on every Aquarian Sadhana CD and is chanted every morning inside the darbar of Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji at the Yogi Bhajan dera Gurdwara!

According to Yogi Bhajan the practice of this mantra is the culmination of hundreds of years of prayer.

This is a Hindu and Sanskrit mantra.

episodes.title: Why does Yogi Bhajan's Cult Security Manual have a Photo of Bhaj Buster, Gursant Singh on the cover?
episodes.description:
The video is a compilation of two hours plus time in which I tried to gain access to visit and have darshan from the Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji which was in Prakash at the Yogi Bhajan "Raj Yoga Festival", 10 miles up the Santa Clara Peak Road above Espanola in the Jemez Mountains of New Mexico. I know Guru Sahib Ji was in prakash because at 4:45 in the video other people driving into the compound said they were attending Gurdwara when asked by security. 

There is a lot of valuable insights into the workings of the Bhajanists'  organizations recorded in the video.

(1) The Bhajanists evidently think my YouTube videos and FB posts exposing Yogi Bhajan's lies and abuses are so damaging to their image that they posted an 8x10 photo of myself on the security table and another in their security manual. You can see this at 9:07 in the video
The caption above my photo on the Bhajanist's security table states, "Have you seen Gursant Singh in the Camp?"  

The caption below my photo on the Bhajanist's security table states, "Not Allowed in Camp?"

(2) In order for the Bhajanists to file an official complaint against me, they had to reveal to the police officer who the authorized person is for making the executive decisions at "Ram Das Puri" LLC. I learned the responsible person and "Manager", who has authority to give me a "No Trespass" notice, is a Guru Sadhana Kaur Khalsa. She is the wife of Sada Sat Simran Singh Khalsa who is the head of the world famous Sikh musician group the "Chardikala Jatha."

 Guru Sadhana Kaur is also the granddaughter of James Angleton who was the disgraced CIA head of counter espionage during the 60's and 70's. Siri Hari Kaur(Cecilia Angleton) is Guru Sadhana Kaur's niece. They are all very wealthy and helped Yogi Bhajan both financially and politically. 
Guru Sadhana Kaur (wearing a yellow kurta) is pictured consulting with the police officer on how to keep me from trespassing on the Yogi Bhajan dera compound at 20:49 in the video. 

Evidently, from what I have heard from reliable sources, there is a lot of infighting going on within the Yogi Bhajan orgs between those who acknowledge accounts of abuse by Yogi Bhajan and those that are complete deniers of any abuse and hold fast to their undying loyalty to Yogi Bhajan. The members who at least acknowledge the abuse did NOT want this "Raj Yoga Festival" to happen but because Guru Sadhana Kaur is a Yogi Bhajan hard core loyalist, she was able to over rule the other faction of moderates. Remember the old saying, "follow the money". YB loved people with power and money so is it any wonder that with all the money and influence these Angleton's have, they are pulling the strings in the YB orgs. 

(3) Kulbir Singh Puri, Yogi Bhajan's son was in the video at 2:18. You can see me asking for Kulbir's help so that I may have access to visit Guru Sahib Ji. Sadly Kulbir shakes his head with a No response and does nothing, instead puts his arm up to block my video camera and drives away.

(4) A former SSSC board member, Guru Amrit Singh Khalsa, is shown many times in the video telling me to leave the compound. Beginning at 58 seconds into the video Guru Amrit Singh Khalsa, wearing a yellow shirt, shows no sympathy for my desire to see Guru Sahib Ji.

Guru Gobind Singh Ji~
ਬਿਨਾ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਕੇਸੰ ਨਰੰ ਭੇਡ ਜਾਨੋ | ਗਹੇ ਕਾਨ ਤਾਕੋ ਕਿਤੈ ਲੈ ਸਿਧਾਨੋ |੯੮|

episodes.title: Resolution "welcoming same sex marriage" in SikhNet & 3HO Gurdwaras, approved by Yogi Bhajan orgs.
episodes.description:
I have just received from a very reliable source, a copy of a 3HO resolution adopted by Yogi Bhajan's leadership organization called the "Khalsa Council"(3H0 leadership), a resolution to endorse same sex marriages in the presence of Siri Guru Granth Sahib Ji ('Anand Karaj' ceremony) in their Gurdwaras. 

In January 2005, the Jathedar (custodian) of Sri Akal Takht Sahib, Amritsar, Punjab, India, the highest seat of Sikh temporal-religious (miri-piri) authority for interpreting Sikh teachings, issued an edict denouncing same-sex marriages, and urging the worldwide Sikh community not to allow such marriages to take place at any Gurdwara." In fact all the Jathedars of the Sikh Community in Punjab, have taken a strong stance against homosexual marriages amongst Sikhs.

Will this resolution by Yogi Bhajan's leadership organization to allow same sex marriages in their Gurdwaras along with their continued violations of the Sikh Rehat Maryada like the practice of astrology, chanting Hindu mantras, tantric yoga and worshiping Hindu deities, motivate Sikh leadership in Amritsar to either excommunicate the Yogi Bhajan organizations from the Khalsa Panth or at least sanction them?

This discussion has been going on among the Yogi Bhajan organizations for a number of years but it seems from Friday's Khalsa Council meetings, that the leadership decided they didn't care what the Akal Takhat thinks about same sex marriage and decided to go along with what the majority of their yoga students want. It looks like it is about keeping yoga students happy and the dollars flowing.

I believe Yogi Bhajan's "Khalsa Council" wants to seize control of worldwide Sikh leadership and subsume Sikhi into their anti-Sikh practices and if the Akal Takhat doesn't step up and excommunicate these frauds, they just might succeed! Let's not forget what Yogi Bhajan's right hand man said 10 years ago: "The Master(Yogi bhajan)later explained to me that was the way it was supposed to be as it was the beginning of the switch in Sikh leadership from the Indian community to the American Sikh yogis – recognized or not." ~ MSS Hari Jiwan Singh Khalsa in a letter to the American Sikh community dated 06/24/2011

Please click on the link to read an article on the subject: http://tatgyan.weebly.com/marriage-in-sikh-faith.html?fbclid=IwAR3quscItufoG5-IOLWmH5ZY0_DGKlBtoiAlZqNi25NFFgR1M5tdrD35G2g

Briefly, the article gives Gurbani shabads which describe marriage to be only between a man and a woman.

episodes.title: The rapist Yogi Bhajan & his fraudulent "Siri Singh Sahib" title continue to be promoted by SikhNet
episodes.description:
Guru Fatha Singh Khalsa, a long-time ardent Yogi Bhajan supporter, has posted a defense on the Gurmat Learning Zone of the "Siri Singh Sahib" title as used by Yogi Bhajan. You may read Guru Fatha Singh's entire post below in one of the screen shots. Here is also a link to his "...substantive material that appears to prove, once and for all, the reality of the title "Siri Singh Sahib" and its origins and support in Siri Amritsar and within the SGPC." https://www.messengerfromthegurushouse.com/siri.html 

My response is as follows:   Allow me to lay out ALL the reasons why: a) There never was is or will be a title "Siri Singh Sahib" or any title of that nature (other than in the perception of Guru Fatha Singh Khalsa and the other Yogi Bhajan defenders) b) This whole thing was a great hoax that was perpetrated by Yogi Bhajan. Of course, it’s hard to prove a negative. That is why I invite Guru Fatha Singh Khalsa or any other Yogi Bhajan supporter to prove that the SSS title was awarded by either the Akaal Takhat or the SGPC. If they are able to post a proclamation or similar document here on this web site stating that the SSS title was awarded to YB I will be the first to admit I am mistaken. Letters addressed to YB do not count; I am well aware that even Gurcharan Singh Tohra - in spite of his denial that the title was ever given – took to addressing YB as SSS in the last years of his life. These are my reasons why I think this was a contrived title: 1: The hukam nama issued by Sadhu Singh Bhora (sp), Jathedar of the Akaal Takhat in 1977 which states, "The title of Singh Sahib or Siri Singh Sahib has never been bestowed by me to any person, since 1965 when I was appointed Jethedar Siri Akal Takhat Sahib Amritsar."  I have attached a screen shot of the letter below. Jethedar Sadhu Singh Bhora was the person who, if the title had actually been issued in 1971, would have been the one doing it. This was all explained in an article by Anju Kaur at the Sikh Free Press "American yogis distort Sikh scripture"  http://web.archive.org/web/20190327091059/http://www.sikhfreepress.org/headlines/2667/american-yogis-distort-sikh-scripture

Anju Kaur also published in this article a Punjabi press clipping showing that Jethedar Sadhu Singh was intending to excommunicate Yogi Bhajan from the Khalsa Panth for teaching tantric yoga etc. I have attached that press article below as well. "Rojaanaa Akaalee Patrikaa Jalandhar | Daily Akali Newspaper, Jalandhar | AKAALEE PATRIKAA | Yogi Bhajan Will Be Excommunicated from the Sikh Panth; Claim of Converting 200,000 Singhs is Wrong – Jathedar Bhaura | Amritsar 10 January – (Special Representative/Reporter) Sri Akal Takhat Sahib’s jathedar, Sadhu Singh Bhaura ji said here today that Yogi Harbhajan having called himself Singh Sahib is wrong. He said he sent a registered letter asking Yogi Bhajan on what authority has he made himself Singh Sahib. He said questions raised in this letter and the related hukamnama (1977) have not yet been responded to by Yogi Bhajan. | Jathedar Bhaura said he will wait a few days and after that he will give one-months' notice to Yogi Bhajan. "If he does not reply, then he will be excommunicated from the Sikh Panth," J. Bhaura said. "The yogi is exploiting Sikhs in the name of Sikhi and making owls (fools) of innocent Americans." He said that the yogi’s claim that he has created 200,000 Singhs is wrong. He said that the actual numbers are 1,500 up to 2,000. He said Sikhi is based on principles, not on beard and long hair alone." 2: There was also another letter sent by the Akal Thakat to Yogi Bhajan in 1979 (attached below) wherein the Akal Thakat warned Yogi Bhajan not to use Siri Singh Sahib title or issue any hukumnama or he would be excommunicated from the panth. 3: YB was a pathological liar. It has been shown on the Wacko World of Yogi Bhajan, time and time again, that YB told many, many lies. He was especially prone to lie about his achievements and qualifications.  The point is that we are looking at someone who seemed to have no hesitation in falsifying qualifications in order to make himself appear grander to the world." http://www.gurmukhyoga.com/forum/index.php?mode=thread&id=424

episodes.title: Attorney for Pamela Dyson author of "Premka":"I never was able to get Yogi Bhajan into a deposition"
episodes.description:

Sikhs and yoga students should all be outraged by the sexual abuses and assaults against yoga students by kundalini yoga instructor Karta Singh. You can see in the photo Karta touching a yoga student most probably without her permission which is unethical and could lead to further unwanted sexual advances.  

The other very troubling fact that has surfaced in these complaints is that Yogi Bhajan 3HO leaders knew about Karta's sexual abuses against his yoga students for over ten years but did nothing to stop it! Current KY trainers and former 3HO members attest in letters at the links in the description to this video that there "... was an incredible amount of teachers sleeping with students and cheating on their spouses going on in Europe..." and many 3HO leaders knew about this more than ten years ago." 

You can see Karta commiserating with his 3HO buddies in this picture. One only needs to visit Karta's Facebook page to see that his friend's list reads like a who's who in the 3HO leadership! Guruka Singh, Sat Santokh Singh, Nirvair Singh, just to name a few, all 3HO and KRI leaders.  

My name is Gursant Singh and as many of you may know, I was in the Yogi Bhajan tantric yoga cult for 30 years and a personal bodyguard to Yogi Bhajan for much of that time in Los Angeles so I am very familiar with what really goes on in the Bhajanist cult. I am of the firm belief that Yogi Bhajan himself was a sexual abuser and even raped his female yoga students! I know this may be hard for many of you to stomach but the truth is that I witnessed Yogi Bhajan sleeping in the same room alone with his female secretaries and when these same female secretaries sued Yogi Bhajan for rape and sexual assault, Yogi Bhajan refused to appear and give his deposition in the cases, he would always get medical excuses from his so called personal"Khalsa" doctors but I know for a fact that Yogi Bhajan was healthy enough to give his deposition because we would all go to La Scala and shop all day in Beverly Hills during this same time when the lawsuits were going on in the 1980's.  

The truth is that Yogi Bhajan cultivated an environment where men in 3HO could get away with sexually abusing women! 


The last straw for me when I knew I had to get away from these toxic sexual predators in Yogi Bhajan's cult was when a male long time Yogi Bhajan disciple & so called friend told me how he had sexually fondled a woman in a one on one personal yoga class he was giving her. Now this male yoga teacher is a certified KY teacher trainer and continues to teach KY to many unsuspecting yoga students. This cannot be allowed to continued and sanctioned!  


3HO needs to wake up and admit to the sexual assaults & other crimes Yogi Bhajan committed against his yoga students! 3HO needs to stop using Yogi Bhajan as a mentor for how 3HO men should act. If 3HO doesn't change this toxic environment and tear down Bhajan's empire built on lies, these sexual abuses and other crimes will continue and get worse  

In conclusion I want to encourage everyone to speak out about this issue, write 3HO, SikhNet, sign this petition and do not let these sexual predators who mooch off of others and take huge amounts of money teaching yoga classes to continue to have power over our sisters, mothers and future generations of women.

Yogi Bhajan’s SikhNet, 3HO and Sikh Dharma International must urgently start listening to concerned Sikhs and take a good hard look at their whole Yogi Bhajan manmat tantra / mantra philosophy before it’s too late! Antion Vikram Singh Meredith says:

episodes.title: Academic study shows the Kundalini Yoga of Yogi Bhajan is a fraud!
episodes.description:
A recent academic paper has thrown new light on the origins of Yogi Bhajan's Kundalini Yoga, casting serious doubts on its supposed origins. 

Sikh Formations: Religion, Culture, Theory

Volume 8, Issue 3, 2012 

Special Issue:The 3HO Sikh Community

FROM MAHARAJ TO MAHAN TANTRIC
The construction of Yogi Bhajan's Kundalini Yoga
http://www.scribd.com/doc/140983448/Maharaj-to-Mahan-Tantric

"As opposed to the official history of Kundalini Yoga that claims it as an ancient and secret tradition prior to Yogi Bhajan's open teaching of it, this article argues that it was a bricolage created by Yogi Bhajan himself...."

Have you read Dr. Trilochan Singh's book from 1977 which is a very good critical analysis of Yogi Bhajan and his practices? The book was a real eye-opener for me! You can download the book for free at: http://gurmukhyoga.com/forum/index.php?mode=page&id=1
 
Best Book About Yogi Bhajan on the Market, January 3, 2013 Review by Scott Free - This review is from: Confessions of an American Sikh: Locked up in India, corrupt cops & my escape from a "New Age" tantric yoga cult! (Kindle only 0.99 cents) http://www.amazon.com/Confessions-American-Sikh-corrupt-ebook/dp/B00ANSWUPM/ref=zg_bs_158529011_1

Write Gursant Singh at Gurusant@hotmail.com for a free pdf copy.
 
Gursant Singh's recounting of his passage to India and out of a corrupt yoga empire is as enjoyable as it is compelling. This is a story of exploitation -- Gursant's victimization by his fraudulent master, Yogi Bhajan, and his own demoralizing work running scams to prop up the yogi's luxurious lifestyle. It's a quick-paced adventure that describes the ersatz Sikh lifestyle dumped on a clutch of white Americans and the peculiar dangers of the Indian bride trade.
 The book revolves around Gursant's quest for a Punjabi marriage partner. His desire to acquire a subservient wife echoes Yogi Bhajan's tantric babble about men and women. If you've endured a Yogi Bhajan "teaching" on sexuality, you'll be dismayed, but not surprised, by his longtime student's view of women. Gursant's role as Bhajan's aide and bodyguard revealed the man his followers refuse to see -- a womanizer and a brute. Yogi Bhajan's round-the-clock use of a dozen female assistants is well-known. Those who question why the self-proclaimed leader of the Sikhs of the Western world required not just a personal harem but an armed security detail will find answers here. Gursant lays out his time among the sleazy operators and criminal hustlers swirling through Yogi Bhajan's Healthy Happy Holy Organization/3HO in some depth -- not enough intricacy for some of us, but doubtless far too much for the old charlatan's remaining devotees.
 
Fortunately, the book doesn't devolve into a personal Mea Culpa nor does it read like the diary of a starry-eyed seeker. The bizarre mishmash of Eastern aphorisms and yoga postures that Yogi Bhajan concocted made his Sikh Dharma group appealing to a small, lost tribe of the counterculture. Mercifully, Gursant was no hippie and he doesn't write like one. Yet his "Confessions of An American Sikh" makes the case for Sikh Dharma's inclusion as a footnote to '60s experimental spirituality. More importantly, this book is a fascinating look at the seamy side of the Indian marriage business and a frank exploration of life in a destructive, authoritarian group.
 
Gursant's tone is appealing whether he is describing the filthy interior of a lock-up in Amritsar or his posh daily luncheons with Yogi Bhajan on Rodeo Drive. His growing disillusionment with Bhajan's bogus spin on the Sikh religion comes to a climax while Gursant is trapped in India. He finds himself trying to emerge from two forms of imprisonment -- one physical and the other spiritual. Through it all, Gursant maintains his sense of humor and his innate faith.
 
This is an absorbing story for any reader. And it's a must-read for those caught up in Yogi Bhajan's 3HO/Sikh Dharma --ex-followers, Second Generation casualties, family members, law enforcement, cult researchers -- and for every Kundalini yoga student or Yogi Tea drinker, past or present. http://www.amazon.com/Confessions-American-Sikh-corrupt-ebook/dp/B00ANSWUPM/ref=zg_bs_158529011_1
